Sahassayāga Sutta：Evidently a name given to one of the Satullapakāyika Suttas （S．i．19），in which the Buddha praises the worth of a small but righteous gift as being far greater than large gifts made un-righteously．

A stanza from this sutta is quoted in the Bilārikosiya Jātaka （J．iv．66） and in the Mahāvamsa Tīkā．MT．596．
